intro: Justicia laetevirens, commonly known as the Happy Vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright orange or red flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Justicia laetevirens is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
